7022ba92-0dda-4b58-963d-fe2796947431.description: IICRC Certified Firms operate under the IICRC's standard of care in the inspection, cleaning, and restoration industries. IICRC Certified Firms are sought after for their industry knowledge and technical expertise, encouraging their technicians to further their career through IICRC education and training.
7022ba92-0dda-4b58-963d-fe2796947431.name: IICRC Certified Firm

alignments.name: IICRC Standards
alignments.description: The IICRC is an American National Standards Institute (ANSI) member and accredited standards developer. ANSI is responsible for overseeing the development of national consensus standards and verifying that the requirements for due process, consensus, and other criteria for approval have been met by the standard’s developer.

badge_template_activities.title: Company must have at least one active IICRC Certified Technician on staff.
Must maintain all required Insurance coverage and region specific business requirements, such as Business License if required.
Agree to IICRC's Code of Ethics and complaint policy.

feb7eac7-b4cc-4b68-9249-6bc55f954556.description: Consensus Body (CB): A committee of voting members that approves the content of a standard and whose vote demonstrates evidence of consensus.
feb7eac7-b4cc-4b68-9249-6bc55f954556.name: IICRC Standards Consensus Body Member

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge is a voluntary member of IICRC's Consensus Body (CB) who shall faithfully fulfill the participation, attendance, voting, communication, and other obligations of membership, and shall comply with these policies and all other rules, regulations, and policies of the Secretariat.  IICRC CB participation shall be open to persons who are directly and materially affected by the standard activity in question.

Voting Consensus Body Member:  A member of a CB, sub-committee, or section committee, charged with the task or project to draft and adopt standards.  Regular members have voting rights on the committee or sub-committee in which they serve and must attend meetings.

feee2dd9-3c80-4af7-8e30-aa16263a7a29.description: IICRC Approved Instructors are vital to the success of the IICRC, and our industry. Instructors can teach all current IICRC Certification Courses and are well versed in the areas they teach and practice; many of them carrying multiple certifications and master designations.
feee2dd9-3c80-4af7-8e30-aa16263a7a29.name: IICRC Approved Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Application materials sent to the I&S Committee for review. 2. If approved, a notice will be posted on the I&S discussion board for 14 days allowing comments to be submitted to the I&S Chair. 3. If after 14 days there is no evidence to hold the application from approval, the I&S Committee submits the application to the Board of Directors at the next available Board Meeting. 4. Final approval by the Board of Directors.

1. Obtain 90% or higher on the last revision of the applicable exam. 2. Minimum of twelve years of formal education. 3. Completion of an Accredited “Train the Trainer” or Public Speaking Course (minimum 8 hours). 4. Master level achieved and/or specific category requirements. 5. Resume or CV. 6. Introductory video to answer questions specific to the category applying for. 7. Participate in a live interview (video conference.)

1098ade8-e3f7-4522-91bf-379d9eb4cab3.description: The IICRC is a global certification and standards organization for the inspection, cleaning, and restoration industries. While the IICRC does not own schools or employ instructors, IICRC Approved Schools fulfill the educational commitment set forth by the Board of Directors based on Industry Standards and Certification requirements.
1098ade8-e3f7-4522-91bf-379d9eb4cab3.name: IICRC Approved School

6cc55da8-33a9-4193-81a4-b3bdb1fe6216.description: An Outreach instructor is defined as a specialist or expert in the subject area, because of education, training, experience, or other qualifications. IICRC Outreach Instructors are authorized to train employees of mills and manufacturers of floor coverings.
6cc55da8-33a9-4193-81a4-b3bdb1fe6216.name: IICRC Approved Outreach Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: 1. Application materials sent to the I&S Committee for review. 2. If approved, a notice will be posted on the I&S discussion board for 14 days allowing comments to be submitted to the I&S Chair. 3. If after 14 days there is no evidence to hold the application from approval, the I&S Committee submits the application to the Board of Directors at the next available Board Meeting. 4. Final approval by the Board of Directors.

1. Obtain 90% or higher on the last revision of the applicable exam. 2. Minimum of twelve years of formal education. 3. Completion of an Accredited “Train the Trainer” or Public Speaking Course (minimum 8 hours). 4. Master level achieved and/or specific category requirements. 5. Resume or CV. 6.
